Text: Nothing was making any sense to me, \n but there was nothing I could do about it.
Compatible
She has \n returned.
Daddy! \n This is my fault. \n I'm so sorry.
We just need to turn \n the clock back to a \n better time.
Dr. Brahman's crimes were revealed to the world, \n but before he could be brought to justice, \n both him and Kali Angel vanished.
Is it her?
Shh, it's alright. \n Wipe your tears.
Grigo showed me the \n answer to our problems.
Run Away without \n Hurting Anyone
This is an emergency broadcast.
Be on the lookout for the Gravity Shifter, Kat.
She is wanted on suspicion of murdering political aide, Adicca.
She is on the loose and highly dangerous.
Kat is suspected of killing government aide, Adicca.
Wanted criminal detected. \n Moving to subdue.
What's with that broadcast!? Why are they lying about me?
They'll catch me if I stay here, I need to get away.
Flee Home
Aujean: \n Kat!
Eugie: \n S-Stay back!
???: \n Wait!
What have I done!?
Mysterious Youth: \n Here they come.
H-Hey, you!
Aujean! Eugie! Listen, \n you've gotta hear me \n out-
There's been a mistake!
Of course... We \n understand, don't we, \n boy?
Sure, we've known each \n other a long time, after \n all.
Aujean... Eugie... I \n guess I misjudged you \n this whole time.
HEEEY! The Killer Queen \n is right here!
Wha-!?

I'm sure you had 
 your reasons, but you 
 gotta pay for your 
 crime.
Don't think bad of us, \n it's just our civic \n duty.
I-I told you there was a \n mistake. I didn't do \n anything!
How did all this happen?
I didn't do anything \n wrong.
If I can just get home \n and have a moment to \n think...
Gravity Queen, you \n should stay away from \n here.
Ah! Wh-Who are you?
The police are on their \n way. You had to know \n they'd look here.
But I don't have \n anywhere else to go...
The fortune teller in \n Pleajeune sent me.
Aki sent you? She's \n helping me?
Are you telling me the \n truth?
You're not just trying \n to put one over on me, \n are you?
Suspicious? That's not \n like you.
Placing your faith in \n others... In the end, it \n will save you.
Now hurry!
Aki, it's me!
Thank you so much for \n believing in me!
Aki?
She's not here...
So that kid was fooling \n me?
My home is gone... Aki's \n gone... I'm all alone.
Ah!
Cornered. \n I'm gonna have to \n fight my way out.
Heya, Gravity Queen, it \n looks like things aren't \n going your way.
What's with \n this Grigo...?
All alone, helpless, no \n one to trust...
Kind of like when you \n first arrived in this \n town, isn't it?
Who's talking through \n that thing? The voice \n sounds familiar...
You'll just have to get \n them to remember who you \n really are.
That you're the true \n defender of this city.
I know it's difficult to \n believe, but I want to \n help you.
Something about that \n voice... What is it?
Alright, you bugged-out \n Grigo, if you want me to \n trust you...
I'll do it.
Thanks Gravity Queen.
To prove your innocence, \n you'll need to proceed \n to the square below.
But be quiet. No gravity \n shifting, and no \n starting fights...
Won't the way be \n guarded?
Just follow me- err, \n this Grigo.
We want to proceed to \n the square, but the \n patrols are too thick.
Let's use a Grigo.
Use a Grigo?
If I hack it, you can \n tell it what to do.
You'll have to lure it \n to me first.

If you enter its sensor 
 range, it'll detect you 
 and come to check on the 
 disturbance.

Just don't get too 
 close, or it'll 
 recognise you and report 
 you to the others.
Keep a safe distance, \n but bring it to me.
While it's worried about \n you, I'll sneak in and \n hack it.
That should do the \n trick. It'll follow your \n orders, for a while.
I reprogrammed it to \n follow you.
If you can get it near a \n police officer before it \n breaks its hacking...
It'll make a false \n report.

If the Grigo starts to 
 head to one of the 
 officers, find a place 
 to hide.
So I just have to get \n this thing near an \n officer now...
The Grigo is about to \n break its hacking.
Better find a safe place \n to hide before it \n resumes its patrol.
There's a limit to how \n long a Grigo will stay \n hacked.
You'll have to do what \n you need to do before \n that time runs out.
Right.
There are still too many \n officers to approach the \n square.
We need to find a way \n around.
Then use the same \n technique to lure them \n away.
And next time, you can \n tell me where I should \n wait.
Why is this Grigo so \n intent on me reaching \n the square, anyway?
What's so special about \n the square?
We need an "appropriate" \n place, trust me on this.
There's only the officer \n on the other side of the \n square now.
What do we do about him?
With a little noise, we \n can pull him away from \n his post.
You just hide here.

When the police officer 
 leaves, head to the 
 middle of the square, 
 we'll meet there.
The Grigo just left...
Guess I'd better do as \n it told me and hide.
*Beep* *Beep*

Suspect is fleeing - 
 they're heading from the 
 goddess statue towards 
 the school!
All units in the area \n respond!
I repeat. Suspect is \n fleeing towards the \n school!
Did the Grigo do that? \n The officer sure took \n off fast.
Shouldn't have any \n trouble reaching the \n square now.
Found you!
...detected. \n Wanted criminal detected.
Gravity Queen!
It's time for this angel to pass judgement on you!
Wait!
You can't be serious, sir.
You're going to sacrifice everyone \n for your daughter.
And your daughter's already-
Don't look.
Dad, what do you need?
Kali, clean up for me.
No problem.
Removing Gravity Queen from wanted list. \n Adding Kali Angel.
Gravity Queen, really, \n you led us on quite a \n chase.
How does it feel to be \n so wanted?
I'm not a criminal!
I wouldn't cooperate \n with Dr. Brahman...
So he made up this whole \n story to set me up!
And who's gonna \n believe that?
Dad is loved, \n and I'm the town's \n guardian angel.
Fine, then explain \n something to me...
How can you trust him?
Why shouldn't I?
He's the one that \n rescued me and my sister \n from the streets...
He's the one that found \n we were compatible.
And he gave me \n the angel egg.
Sister...? \n That means-
Well, a little accident \n pulled my sister away \n from me...
But it also made me what \n I am now!
Of course, I'd like \n nothing more than for \n her to come home.
But I'll make do with \n you if Dad thinks that's \n for the best.
Kali, wait! The "Missing \n Orphans Case", are you-
Before I arrest you, I \n guess I should take care \n of that buggy Grigo.
Oh, it's the officer \n that failed to protect \n Dad from the rebels.
Well, I've already done \n your job for you and \n found the criminal.
You can always depend on \n the police to be too \n little, too late.
Dad said so too. But \n that'll be our little \n secret.
My apologies, ma'am, \n I was looking for \n something.
What could be more \n important than finding \n the criminal?

The truth... 
 Specifically the truth 
 as overheard by one of 
 the Grigos.

Kali, really... You and 
 your Dad need to learn 
 how to clean up after 
 yourselves...
I recovered the Grigo's \n memory core.
Admittedly, I'm not much \n of an engineer...

But all of those 
 training sessions you 
 gave us on the Grigos 
 came in handy.
Now, for the truth!
That's-!
Raven! Cecie!
H-How are you here?
A man told me \n you needed saving.
But I can explain later, \n let's finish 'em off.
As I was saying, the man \n told me you needed \n saving.
H-He had a strange \n voice. Kinda like a \n machine.
Sure is a lot to \n swallow.

When I first heard all 
 of this from Aki, I 
 wasn't sure what was 
 going on.
Pandora started speaking \n in a strange, \n machine-like voice too.
It told me to "Expose \n Mayor Brahman and Kali, \n the Guardian Angel".
So all of you were led \n here by the same \n mysterious voice?
Do you have any idea \n who, or what, it might \n be?
Sorry... Though the \n voice does sound \n familiar.
Familiar...?
Well, anyway, I'm \n heading back to the \n station.

I have to update them on 
 what's going on. I'll 
 also put out an APB 
 on Brahman.
Miss Raven, and... Miss \n Cecie, was it?
Would you mind \n accompanying me to the \n station?
Now that you're in \n Hekseville, you'll need \n to register as citizens.
Register? Since when do \n we have to register to \n live here?
Raven, trust me, life \n will be easier if you \n just do it.
Flee to Aki's Place
Wait, where'd that kid go?
I didn't do anything!
Follow the Strange Grigo
Lure in a Grigo
Defeat Kali
Kali, stop this!
Kali, wait. Don't you remember the Missing Orphans?
Kali: \n Can't you just go down quietly?
Kali: \n Hmph, just a scratch.
Kali: \n The more you resist, the more you'll suffer.
Kali's wounds are healing!?
Kali: \n Get back here so we can settle this!
I can't lose!
Agh, she's tough...
Defeat Kali
Raven: \n Kat!
Raven: \n Hang in there!
Raven: \n Kat, hold it together!
Raven: \n Kat, are you okay!?
Raven: \n Come on, Kat!
Kali: \n Are you looking to get hurt!?
Kali: \n Playtime's over!
Kali: \n Why won't you just give up, Gravity Queen!?
Kali... She's healing?
Kali: \n Get back here, I'll take you both on!
Strange Grigo: \n Hmm, patrol's pretty heavy.
Strange Grigo: \n Done hacking, now to lead it near an officer...
Strange Grigo: \n Hmm...
Strange Grigo: \n Better get that next officer to move.
Strange Grigo: \n Now for that officer.
Strange Grigo: \n This place looks safe for now.
Strange Grigo: \n H-Hey, I'm on your side!
Strange Grigo: \n S-Stop that!
Strange Grigo: \n Strange way to treat a friend!
Wait Here
Follow Me
Strange Grigo: \n Done hacking, now to lead it near an officer...
Two Grigos! Better deal with them one at a time.
Strange Grigo: \n This isn't where we need to go.
Grigo: \n Currently under attack.
Grigo: \n Switching to battle mode.
Grigo: \n Suspicious person detected.
Grigo: \n Commencing search.
Grigo: \n Returning to patrol range.
Grigo: \n Suspect sighted.
Grigo: \n Suspect lost.
Grigo: \n Lowering alert level.
Grigo: \n Gravitational abnormality detected.
Police Officer: \n I'm under attack by the suspect!
Police Officer: \n Hm? What's this?
Police Officer: \n Eh, someone else can handle it.
Police Officer: \n Where'd she go!?
Police Officer: \n Oh well, guess I'd better resume my patrol.
Grigo: \n Suspect sighted. Apprehending...
Aww, man...
Police Officer: \n Taking suspect into custody!
I'm not the real criminal...
Police Officer: \n Over there!
Spotted!
Grigo: \n Drawing... attention... Alert, alert!
Police Officer: \n Huh? See something?
Take the Hacked Grigo \n to a Police Officer
Hide and Watch the Grigo
Hack the Grigo and \n Draw it to an Officer
I can't shift, they'll spot me.
Not this way...
Daddy?
Durga.
